summary: This influencer marketing contract heavily favors the Brand with numerous high-risk clauses for the Creator. Major concerns include unlimited indemnification, perpetual content usage rights, broad non-compete restrictions, one-sided termination rights, and subjective morality clauses. The overall risk profile is very high for the Creator.

risks.location: Creator shall indemnify Brand against all claims arising from Creator's content, including FTC violations, false advertising claims, and intellectual property disputes, even if resulting from Brand-approved talking points.
risks.explanation: Unlimited indemnification with no caps, covering claims even when Brand approves the content. This creates unlimited liability exposure for the Creator.
risks.suggested_fix: Cap indemnification amount and exclude claims arising from Brand-provided content or instructions
risks.rewrite_suggestion: Creator shall indemnify Brand against claims arising solely from Creator's unauthorized modifications to Brand-approved content, with total liability capped at the compensation amount paid under this agreement.

risks.location: Creator grants Brand an exclusive, perpetual, worldwide, royalty-free license to use, edit, and repurpose all content across any media, including paid advertising, packaging, and sublicensing to retail partners. Brand may use Creator's name, likeness, and voice indefinitely.
risks.explanation: Extremely broad IP transfer giving Brand perpetual, unlimited rights to Creator's content, name, and likeness without additional compensation.
risks.suggested_fix: Limit usage rights to specific purposes and time periods, require additional compensation for extended use
risks.rewrite_suggestion: Creator grants Brand a non-exclusive, 2-year license to use content for social media marketing only. Any use in paid advertising or packaging requires separate agreement and additional compensation.

risks.location: Creator shall not promote any supplements, energy drinks, or fitness nutrition products from other brands for 12 months following campaign completion.
risks.explanation: Overly broad 12-month non-compete restriction covering entire fitness nutrition category, potentially limiting Creator's income significantly.
risks.suggested_fix: Narrow to direct competitors only and reduce duration
risks.rewrite_suggestion: Creator shall not promote pre-workout supplements that directly compete with ElectraBoost for 3 months following campaign completion.

risks.location: Brand may terminate for any reason with 7 days notice, paying only for completed deliverables. Creator may not terminate once initial payment is received.
risks.explanation: Completely one-sided termination rights. Brand can terminate at will while Creator is locked in after initial payment.
risks.suggested_fix: Provide mutual termination rights with appropriate notice periods
risks.rewrite_suggestion: Either party may terminate with 14 days written notice. Upon termination, Brand pays for all work completed to date plus a kill fee of 25% of remaining compensation.

risks.location: Brand may terminate immediately and recover all payments if Creator engages in conduct that, in Brand's sole opinion, damages Brand's reputation or public image.
risks.explanation: Subjective morality clause gives Brand unlimited discretion to terminate and clawback payments based on their opinion alone.
risks.suggested_fix: Define specific prohibited conduct and remove payment recovery provision
risks.rewrite_suggestion: Brand may terminate if Creator is convicted of a felony or engages in conduct that materially damages Brand's reputation, as determined by reasonable business standards. No payment recovery required.

risks.location: Brand shall pay Creator $3,000 total, payable 50% upon signing and 50% within 60 days of final deliverable.
risks.explanation: 60-day payment terms are longer than industry standard and create cash flow issues for Creator.
risks.suggested_fix: Shorten final payment terms to 30 days maximum
risks.rewrite_suggestion: Brand shall pay Creator $3,000 total, payable 50% upon signing and 50% within 30 days of final deliverable approval.

risks.location: Brand may request unlimited revisions until satisfied.
risks.explanation: Unlimited revision clause with no time limits could lead to scope creep and indefinite work requirements.
risks.suggested_fix: Limit revisions to a reasonable number with defined criteria
risks.rewrite_suggestion: Brand may request up to 2 rounds of revisions per deliverable, with specific feedback provided within 3 business days of submission.

risks.location: Creator may not delete posted content without Brand approval for 2 years.
risks.explanation: Long-term restriction on Creator's ability to manage their own social media content.
risks.suggested_fix: Reduce time period and allow deletion for legitimate reasons
risks.rewrite_suggestion: Creator may not delete posted content for 6 months without Brand approval, except for platform policy violations or legal requirements.

missing_clauses: Creator's right to use content in portfolio
key_dates: 5 business days before posting (Content approval deadline)
60 days after final deliverable (Final payment due)
